intro: Tzveleviochloa burmanica, commonly known as Burmese grass, is a species of grass native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, lowland areas and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowering stems bear small, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Tzveleviochloa burmanica is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of environmental changes in its habitat.
